title: A Secret Garden in Kaohsiung Harbor
content: Tucked away behind Piers 3 to 5 of Kaohsiung Harbor, Kao Port Park is a hidden gem inspired by the concept of an ocean garden city. Covering 4,300 square meters, it boasts over 50,000 plants and incorporates existing air raid shelters and vegetation to create a miniature forest sanctuary within the harbor.

title: Urban Forest and Natural Scenery
content: Enter through the hollow of the Sunlight Tree at the entrance, and you'll feel like you've stepped into a tropical island forest. The park features a waterfall forest inspired by Kaohsiung's Chai Mountain, a misty Forget Worries pond and bridge, a tree archway, an exploration path, a heart-shaped stone weir, and a lucky clover windmill.

title: Tropical South Pacific Pavilion
content: At the wooden pavilion, you'll find a scene straight out of a South Pacific vacation, with sunshine, a sandy beach, and swaying palm trees. The fine golden sand is a hit with kids and families.

title: Panoramic Views from the Observation Deck
content: Standing on the observation deck atop the air raid shelter, you can take in the beautiful surroundings of the port. If you're lucky, you might see a cruise ship or a large vessel entering the harbor, set against the backdrop of the blue sea and sky, offering visitors a unique glimpse of Kaohsiung's port scenery.
